subject: Re: [junit] Using JUnit Inside Application Server?
msgSnippet: probably it is not the perfect solution but... Soppose we want to test a method that at some point does something like: Connection
messageBody:
probably it is not the perfect solution but...
Soppose we want to test a method that at some point does something like:

Connection connection=ConnectionPool.getConnection();

I imagine this can be the kind of problem you have, right?

you can:
1- extract the retrieving of the connection into a method:

protected Connection getConnection()
{
return ConnectionPool.getConnection();
}

2- using ineritance create a class that extends the one you want to test:
class TestableClass extends YourClass {...}

3- in the extending class you can override the getConnection method so that
it retrieves itself the needed connection

4-write the test using TestableClass instead of YourClass

given this you could even (and better) use the getConnection method as
insertion point to use a stub or mock for the real connection.
